function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Estimating the average upper-room irradiation flux for reduction in aerosolised SARS-CoV-2 virions may lead to incorrect UV-C dosing","Impact":"Ineffective reduction of SARS-CoV-2 virions and potential continued spread of the virus","Mitigation":"Use precise measurements and calculations for UV-C dosing based on well-established guidelines and standards. Consider multiple validation studies.","Technologies":"Precise UV-C dosimeters for accurate measurement, air sampling and analysis for viral presence","People":"Researchers, scientists, and engineers involved in UV-C dosing calculations","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Modeling the performance of a standard upper-room UV fitting when challenged by SARS-CoV-2 may result in inaccurate assessment of its effectiveness","Impact":"Potential overestimation of the UV fitting's efficacy in reducing SARS-CoV-2 spread","Mitigation":"Conduct controlled experiments to validate the performance of the UV fitting against SARS-CoV-2. Utilize real-world testing scenarios to account for varying conditions.","Technologies":"Biological safety cabinets, controlled environmental chambers for testing, real-time PCR for viral detection","People":"Biomedical engineers, virologists, and researchers testing UV fittings","Owner":"Biomedical research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Reliance on published literature and studies for UV-C doses and log reductions without independent validation introduces risk of using potentially inaccurate data","Impact":"Miscalculation of required UV-C doses and log reductions, leading to ineffective viral disinfection","Mitigation":"Verify and validate published literature through independent studies and experiments. Emphasize peer-reviewed, well-documented research for benchmarking and evaluation.","Technologies":"Laboratory equipment for viral cultures, PCR for genetic detection, peer-review platforms for literature validation","People":"Virologists, epidemiologists, and researchers verifying published literature","Owner":"Academic institutions, public health organizations"}]}
